Ok, I need some help.  I'm upgrading from junit 3.8.1
to 4.1, and I'm having trouble with step 1.  I can't
get junit's own tests to run.  From a clean install on
Mac OSX 10.4.7, I try the following:

	java -classpath . org.junit.runner.JUnitCore
org.junit.tests.AllTests

and I receive:

	JUnit version 4.1
	Could not find class: org.junit.tests.AllTests

	Time: 0.001

	OK (0 tests)

Naturally I think I have a classpath problem, but
everything looks ok to me.  To try to eliminate the
problem, put the following class in the top level of
the junit4.1 directory and ran it:

	public class Tester
	{
		public static void main(String... args)
		{
			for(String each : args)
			try { Class.forName(each); }
			catch(ClassNotFoundException e)
			{ System.err.println(e); }
		}
	}

and ran it like this:

	java -classpath . Tester org.junit.tests.AllTests

and received no output, indicating success.  Just to
be sure, I tried:

	java -classpath . Tester org.junit.tests.DoesNotExist

and received:

	java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
org.junit.tests.DoesNotExist

as expected.

So, the junit test classes are on the classpath and
Class.forName() can load them.  Further tests with
-verbose confirm this.  I am wondering if perhaps
junit is doing something with class loading which
doesn't work quite right on MacOS.  But I'm probably
missing something obvious, but I can't figure it out. 
 HELP!

j0hnc
